ca.mcgill.ecse211.localization

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.localization.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains every method that is useful for the robot's navigation. This means navigation to a specific point, rotation to a specific angle or avoiding obstacles. It also contains useful methods that convert distances to wheel rotations and angles to distances, which are useful for navigation. Finally, there is also a method to calculate the closest gridpoint to the robots location.
    Author:
    Romain, Lara, Matthew

      • setOdometer

        public static void setOdometer(Odometer odometer)

      • taxiTravelTo

        public static void taxiTravelTo(double x,
                                double y,
                                boolean xFirst,
                                boolean isCorrected)
        Travels to the specified coordinates parallel to the x and y axes. If odometer correction is enabled, the robot will physically correct itself at each perpendicular line on its path.
        Parameters:
        x - continuous x coordinate in cm
        y - continuous y coordinate in cm
        xFirst - boolean which indicates if the robot will travel along the x axis first
        isCorrected - odometry correction is enabled

      • taxiTravelTo

        public static void taxiTravelTo(int x,
                                int y,
                                boolean xFirst,
                                boolean isCorrected)
        Taxi travel to, but takes grid intersection coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - x grid coordinate
        y - y grid coordinate
        xFirst - robot will travel along the x axis first
        isCorrected - odometry correction is enabled

        public static void travelTo(double x,

        Travels to the specified set of continuous coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - double x continuous coordinate
        y - double y continuous coordinate
        isCorrected - boolean which indicates if the odometry correction is active

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo(int x,
                            int y,

        Travels to the specified set of grid intersection coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - integer x intersection coordinate
        y - integer y intersection coordinate
        isCorrected - boolean which indicates if the odometry correction is active

      • travelDistance

        Parameters:

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        Causes the robot to rotate to the angle theta by minimal angle to its target
        Parameters:
        theta - double angle to turn to in degrees

      • findTravelAngle

        public static int findTravelAngle(java.lang.String axis,
                                  double curXY,
                                  double nextXY)
        Finds the angle towards which the robot must turn to travel either in X or Y directions
        Parameters:
        axis - X or Y axis
        curXY - current X or Y coordinate (depending on set axis)
        nextXY - next X or Y coordinate (depending on set axis)
        Returns:
        int the angle the robot should turn to

      • getQuadrant

        public static int getQuadrant(double angle)
        returns the quadrant that the right light sensor is in when the robot is on an intersection
        Parameters:
        angle - angle of the robot
        Returns:
        quadrant the right light sensor is in (0 = bottom left, 1 = bottom right, 2 = top right, 2 = top left

        Returns:

      • setMotorSpeeds

        public static void setMotorSpeeds(int speed,
                                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                                  double l_wheel_rad,
                                  double r_wheel_rad)
        Sets the motor angular speeds of the left and right wheels according to whichever wheel travels faster at that speed. Used to synchronize linear wheel speeds for straight driving and turning in place.
        Parameters:
        speed - desired motor speed
        leftMotor -
        rightMotor -
        l_wheel_rad - left wheel radius
        r_wheel_rad - right wheel radius
